messages.message:
:yellow_circle: :yellow_circle: *Local (temporary) Docker build fix* :yellow_circle: :yellow_circle: 

Hi there! Our multilayered inclusion of Makefiles has continued its trend of proving to be problematic. :slightly_smiling_face:

If you get an error running `make build-docker` locally for any service(s) using our anti-pattern of separate `Dockerfile.*` build workflows (ie: the service contains a `Dockerfile.build` _*and*_ `Dockerfile`), specifically:
```ERROR: no builder "container" found```
You can make this *LOCAL ONLY* fix for the moment to get unblocked — _*DO NOT MERGE THIS CHANGE,*_ please:
```sed -I '' \
  's/DOCKER_BUILD_LOCAL_ONLY_CMD/DOCKER_BUILD_CMD/' \
  shared-utils/build-utils/shared/build-go-service.mk```
I have a refactor I’m testing now that should account for these cases and have a better “catch-all” behavior, but it’ll take me a bit to test properly through sandboxes and unit test pipelines.

I’ll update here when I have the fix merged! :+1:

I have a fix for this up, just redeploying my sandbox to be sure I didn’t goof it up.
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/50012

Will be AFK for an hour or so shortly, will check back in after.

Well I fixed an issue, but now preprod in a weird place again
Will look when I get home from my son’s class
